5.15.19  1:00 pm   Are you still picking songs from the list to complete, or are you using brand new material for right now?

     the way it works now is i do 'general writing' sessions for a certain amount of time (adding new things to the list). Then, after that, i do a throrough (fast) comb through the entire list, narrow it down to about 20-40 finalists, then immediately randomize from there. entire selection process including the generalized writing can be executed in 2 hours

5.15.19  11:39 am   what inspired the mcdonalds song?

     the atlantic avenue mall mcdonald's within the opening hour on sept 18, 2010. probably one of those mornings where 16 different machines are all making different beep warning sounds warning you (the employee) that the food might somehow be bad in whichever way that particular machine is supposed to prevent

5.14.19  11:34 pm   Hmm, I think found a really nice place to add a new chord, but I just can't seem to find a chord to fit at that moment. I'm trying to make the chord using the first note of that new bar, but the chords I'm trying just don't sound right (maybe it's just me). Do you have advice on figuring out a chord for a particular moment?

     just add 1 note to that moment, in addition to the note that's already there. like in happy birthday to you, if it's in the key of C let's say, ... let's pick the very last moment of the song, "you", a 3rd above. (sing E in harmony with the C note on 'you.') but don't take my word for it, try this one in your spare time

5.14.19  10:25 am   My friend listens to a lot of your music, but his dad gets mad at him for it because he doesn't consider your music "real music". Is there anything my friend could say to him to prove him that your music is real music? (Even though all music is real music, and it's stupid that my friend has to deal with this). 

     my friend gets mad at my other friend because they don't think you are a real person. what now

5.14.19  9:45 am   5.11.19  12:12 pm - Yes, it would be "a good album". Seriously! All the albums that really are worth the candle and aren't just "compilations of songs" already do that, at least in my eyes. Take Daft Punk's Discovery for example, or Janet Jackson's The Velvet Rope. Albums that have so many twists and turns that to share only one song off of it at a time is kind of doing it an injustice. THAT'S a sign of a good album - when you need someone to take in the total package rather than just a singular song. It'd be like taking a chord from a song and just playing that rather than the whole song; sure you can do it, but to get the whole scope of things, you need the entire track. An album should be like that, I feel.

     seems like it could be better if it had a little more non-song content to fill it out. at least enough so that calling it an album would be a stretch, and it would be better off called a 'movie' or 'story' or at the very least a 'musical'

5.14.19  9:00 am   Does it also bother you when people say men-at-arm to address one of the many men-at-arms, when they should actually say man-at-arms?

     never heard of it

5.13.19  11:29 pm   what is a key (music wise. not the type you unlock things with and not the type on your keyboard)

     any song still works if you sing the entire song higher. or the entire song lower. the key is how high you sang it. but as you get higher the keys actually repeat themselves, that's because if you sing a note twice as high it sounds higher but feels the same

5.13.19  11:06 pm    what is the most human of all musics

     bobby mcferrin
